intro: Scabiosa afghanica, commonly known as the Afghan sainfoin, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its clusters of small, pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky environments and is adapted to arid conditions. Its leaves are opposite and pinnately divided, giving it a distinctive appearance. Scabiosa afghanica is often used in traditional medicine and is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental qualities.
